title: I don't know how, but I won a lost game
body:
It made me realize for the first time in all of my time in league about how important it is to have teamwork and co operation.
it is so sad to think about all of the egotistic bullying that really shuts down what makes league such a great gaming and/or competitive experience when not going verbal ham on your allies for feeding or ect...

We won because we didn't harras anyone
we won because we worked together even though the enemy brand could have pentakilled us alone
we won because it is ok to screw up, just the abuse and feeling bad after that is the real problem.
we won because even though every lane collapsed, (except mine though I didn't fare very well either) we pulled together, focused our efforts, listened to each other and understood that the game isn't about us, it is about everyone else in our team AND us.

In league, you cant make it alone
But 99/100 you can make it with your team

Peace out - Chicken4dinner, born again league of legends player.

replies.body:
Yes, it has happened a plenty of times. We get behind, we stay behind, we stall to late game, and then we push mid and win.

When no body on the team flames, it makes it easier to work together and defend an objective, not only in League but in any objective based MMO.

{{champion:32}} so.. beautiful

"and at that moment, the smell of a shattering nexus spread through the air in the enemies base and he wept, for he too, had experienced the bright warmth of cooperation in his fellows hearts. with the taste of victory on his tongue and his trembling hands on the keyboard he smiled.. ever so slightly.."

what you say is so true, being positive and helpful is one of the best things you can do to win, for example. i played a ranked game as Karthus, was having a bad day, gave first blood to udyr very early and by 11 min their fizz had 3 kills on me already, (and a fed fizz especially that early is very very bad) and our jungler, master YI instead of saying "oh Karth you suck, go home feeding noob" etc, he camped my lane really hard and evened the playing field, and got me back on my feet, and in the end i ended up getting a pentakill with Karthus wearing the pentakill Karthus skin in ranked which is a really legit penta, and getting 20 kills overall, and better still we managed to win, all because my team didnt judge me and go afk when i was feeding and all of them stuck close to me to help out.

Teamwork is important as Hell. I once won a 2v5 because the enemy team had no teamwork and it allowed the two of us to win a heap of 1v1s and 1v2s all over the map. A lack of it can screw everyone up. I've lost games where I've had a huge advantage because I was too busy doing my own thing.
It's the best feeling to comeback from a lost game. :)

We won becasue we had a yi.
where is that in the text?
Are you a winner winner, Chicken4dinner? 'Cause you sound like one. And sounding is half the battle.
Or the enemies just couldn't close out the game?
